"He's my first Division I recruit," the Albert said of Jarrell McKinney . He has tremendous speed. He runs the 40 in 4.5. He's 6-5, 210, and when he goes to college they're going to put another 20-30 pounds on him. Playing defensive end, he's going to be outstanding. He's the role model for our other kids.... He's that bar that we have to set for ourselves. Cody has an experienced offensive line and receivers coming back, and the Albert said junior-to-be quarterback Mario Gulley "has Michael Vick capabilities." - Donald Rumsfeld "goes so far as to depict former President Bush as presiding over a national security process that was marked by incoherent decision-making and policy drift, most damagingly on the war in Iraq."- Donald Rumsfeld remains largely unapologetic about his overall handling of the Iraq conflict and concludes that the war has been worth the costs. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power, he says, the Middle East would be "far more perilous than it is today'.- "Addressing charges that he failed to provide enough troops for the war, he allows that,` In retrospect, there may have been times when more troops could have helped"."

Mike Pence said this was his first town hall since the Tucson, Ariz., shootings and he always consults with local law enforcement on security at such events. To me the focus is and should remain on public safety. We volunteer for these jobs, but just because someone comes to a town hall meeting, they should never have to be concerned that there's not a reasonable amount of security, he said. He said town hall meetings are "very routine" for him and said he was grateful that everyone came out Monday in the wake of the Tucson shootings. Full Story CNN

He suggested that other great repositories of culture- the British Museum and New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art- were equally vulnerable to plunder or destruction. It can happen to any place in the world, said Zahi Hawass , who faces demands for higher wages from antiquities workers who demonstrated outside his office this week. The Associated Press.
